title: Sex murder uncovered after woman finds memory card with bloodbath clip on street
text:
Brian Smith has been charged with the brutal torture, rape, and murder of Kathleen Henry. (Picture: AP/KTVA)

A horrific sex killing was uncovered after a stunned woman found a memory card containing a video the perpetrator had made of himself raping and killing his victim.

Brian Smith, 48, was arrested last week in Anchorage, Alaska after a woman discovered an SD card on the ground that had 39 photos and 12 videos that show a man ‘beating’ and ‘raping’ a woman, police said.

Detectives examined the contents of the card, labeled ‘Homicide at Midtown Marriott,’ and said the digital files show Smith battering the woman while telling her to die. At times he is even heard laughing while carrying out the brutal torture, it is alleged.

Police later identified the victim as 30-year-old Katherine Henry, whose remains were found dumped off the Seward Highway less than a week before the SD card was found.

Investigators said they were also able to identify Smith as the man in the video because of his distinct ‘English-sounding’ accent. The Alaska Police department said Smith is an immigrant from South Africa.

Smith was already known to police because he was a suspect in a different investigation, although authorities have not released the nature of that investigation, according to KTVA.

Hotel records from the TownePlace Suites by Marriott show Smith stayed from September 2-4. Police said, on September 6, Smith’s cellphone pinged in the area where Henry’s body was found approximately a month later.

Dog walker, 68, 'smashed young boy's face into ground after being hit by snowball'

Detectives also matched photos of a partial license plate from the memory card to a black pickup truck registered to Smith and his wife, Stephanie Bissland.

Bissland, who was visiting family in Virginia when she learned the news, told KTUU: ‘Never in my life would I have thought what they are saying is going on … I don’t believe it.’

Stephanie Bissland defended her husband after learning he had been charged with murder and sexual assault (Picture: KTUU)

‘I’ll stand behind him, beside him, while he’s going through this,’ she said, adding that Henry ‘was a good husband.’

Smith has been charged with one count of first-degree murder, two counts of second-degree murder, two counts of second-degree sex assault, and two counts of tampering with evidence.

He is scheduled to be arraigned in Anchorage on Wednesday afternoon and is currently being held on a $750,000 cash bail.
description: Brian Smith, 48, was arrested last week in Anchorage, Alaska after a woman found a SD card depicting the rape and murder of Kathleen Henry.
